discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
FGCP = FortiGate Clustering Protocol
It select the primary device and use heartbeat links to take the decision

Selected Answer: BD
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/fortinet/view/94345-exam-nse4_fgt-72-topic-1-question-15-discussion/

comments.content:
The FortiGate Clustering Protocol (FGCP) is a proprietary HA solution whereby FortiGates can find other member FortiGates to negotiate and create a cluster.
The following are best practices for general cluster operation:
Ensure that heartbeat communication is present.

discussion.content:
BD are correct.
These statements are true because the FGCP protocol is specifically designed to operate over heartbeat links to ensure communication and synchronization between cluster units, and it is responsible for electing the primary FortiGate device within the cluster.
BD correct

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the FGCP protocol? (Choose two.)

choices.B: FGCP elects the primary FortiGate device
choices.A: FGCP is not used when FortiGate is in transparent mode
choices.D: FGCP runs only over the heartbeat links
choices.C: FGCP is used to discover FortiGate devices in different HA groups

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Option A, but wondering how to use it in a real life case...

Selected Answer: A
Should be A

Selected Answer: A
page 106 of FGT 7.4 ASG
A are correct
A correct

choices.C: This option places all FortiGate users and groups required to authenticate into the RADIUS server, which, in this case is FortiAuthenticator
choices.A: This option places the RADIUS server, and all users who can authenticate against that server, into every FortiGate user group
choices.B: This option places all users into every RADIUS user group, including groups that are used for the LDAP server on FortiGate
choices.D: This option places the RADIUS server, and all users who can authenticate against that server, into every RADIUS group

An administrator added a configuration for a new RADIUS server. While configuring, the administrator selected the Include in every user group option.

What is the impact of using the Include in every user group option in a RADIUS configuration?
Which statement about the deployment of the Security Fabric in a multi-VDOM environment is true?

choices.C: VDOMs without ports with connected devices are not displayed in the topology
choices.D: Security rating reports can be run individually for each configured VDOM
choices.A: Downstream devices can connect to the upstream device from any of their VDOMs
choices.B: Each VDOM in the environment can be part of a different Security Fabric

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C
FCPFGT Administrator 7.4 Study Guide.
Page: 392

comments.content: I miss-copied the quote, it exactly quotes "VDOMs without ports with connected devices are not displayed in the topology".

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It is C and is quoted word for word in the Study Guide, Page 392: "Security rating reports can be run individually for each configured VDOM"

Selected Answer: C
VDOM without configured ports can't do anything right? XD

comments.content: It doesn't say that the ports are not configured, but that there are no connected devices. Although it would be more accurate to say detected devices.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
FortiGate Security 7.2 Study Guide (p.436):
"When you configure FortiGate devices in multi-vdom mode and add them to the Security Fabric, each VDOM with its assigned ports is displayed when one or more devices are detected. Only the ports with discovered and connected devices appear in the Security Fabric view and, because of this, you must enable Device Detection on ports you want to have displayed in the Security Fabric. VDOMs without ports with connected devices are not displayed. All VDOMs configured must be part of a single Security Fabric."
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/fortinet/view/115057-exam-nse4_fgt-72-topic-1-question-80-discussion/

Selected Answer: C
FGT 7.4 ASG

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. All vdoms are shown in the security fabric except the ones that do not have ports connected to any devices because of which its important to enable device detection on all ports so they are discovered.

comments.content: My bad, C is the correct one

discussion.content:

"In a multi-VDOM environment, you can configure each individual VDOM to be a part of a different Security Fabric. This allows for flexibility in network segmentation and the independent management of security policies and threat intelligence across various parts of the network. This is one of the strengths of FortiGate's multi-VDOM feature."

choices.B: There is no application control profile applied to the firewall policy.

questions.question_text:

The administrator configured SD-WAN rules and set the FortiGate traffic log page to display SD-WAN-specific columns: SD-WAN Quality and SD-WAN Rule Name.

FortiGate allows the traffic according to policy ID 1. This is the policy that allows SD-WAN traffic.

Despite these settings the traffic logs do not show the name of the SD-WAN rule used to steer those traffic flows.

What can be the reason?
